measured_by: Two-item responsibility concern scale (worry about being the only imposer; reassurance about not being solely responsible)
justification: “we measured participants' responsibility concern (averaging two items described in the Methods)” and the items immediately follow (worry about sole responsibility and reassurance if others would also impose).

measured_by: Confidence-threshold slider asking for the minimum percentage certainty (50–100%) needed before imposing
justification: “participants … decided how strong their signal would have to be … for them to do so. … participants pre-committed to a confidence threshold” entered on a 50–100% slider.

measured_by: Single binary voting item: ‘Vote in favor of the new plan’ vs. ‘Vote against the new plan, effectively vetoing it’
justification: “All participants were then asked … ‘On your secret ballot, would you vote in favor of or against the new plan?’” which directly records whether they would use their veto.

measured_by: 5-point Likert ratings of how likely each process is to achieve the best policies
justification: Participants answered a matrix question rating various decision-making procedures on a 1 (extremely unlikely) to 5 (extremely likely) scale to indicate their perceived efficacy.
